title: Citi Named "Best Regional Derivatives Provider" in Latin America by Global Finance Magazine for Second Consecutive Year
summary: Miami, Florida - Citi has been named "Best Regional Derivatives Provider in Latin America" by Global Finance magazine, for the second consecutive year, as part of the eighth annual "World's Best Derivatives Providers" awards for 2012. A full report on the awards will be published in the December issue of the prestigious publication.
tag-1: Citi Named "Best Regional Derivatives Provider" in Latin America by Global Finance Magazine for Second Consecutive Year
tag-2: Miami, Florida – Citi has been named "Best Regional Derivatives Provider in Latin America" by Global Finance magazine, for the second consecutive year, as part of the eighth annual "World's Best Derivatives Providers" awards for 2012. A full report on the awards will be published in the December issue of the prestigious publication.
tag-3: "We are honored to once again receive this recognition from our clients in Latin America," said Jaime Roblesgil, Citi Markets Head, Latin America. "These awards are a testament to the confidence our clients have in us and to our highly talented team, who are committed to continue providing the best derivates products and services to our clients in the region at the highest standards of excellence."
tag-4: Global Finance's editors selected the winners based on in depth interviews and email exchanges with end user derivatives. Among the sources were financial research analysts, traders, risk managers of financial and nonfinancial corporations, as well as portfolio managers of mutual funds and hedge funds. For the selection process of this award, editors focused on sources such as funds and corporations that have distinguished themselves with relative outperformance since the global financial crisis of 2008.
tag-5: "In a year of undulating market and uncertainty, derivatives providers have come under close scrutiny by their clients. Our winners are those who have the confidence of their clients as they face unknown challenges ahead," said Joseph Giarraputo, publisher of Global Finance.
tag-6: A variety of subjective and quantitative criteria were used for choosing the winners of the Derivatives Provider awards. Factors considered included: transaction pricing, product innovation, the quality of information that providers supply in the process of executing a deal, the breadth of liquid names in which a provider makes markets, a provider's willingness to use its own balance sheet to offer liquidity to a client, and the inclination of a provider to step into the breach in a high-risk situation.
tag-7: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.

tag-9: Global Finance Founded in 1987, Global Finance has a circulation of 50,050 and readers in 163 countries. Its circulation is audited by BPA. Global Finance's audience includes chairmen, presidents, CEOs, CFOs, treasurers and other senior financial officers responsible for making investment and strategic decisions at multinational companies and financial institutions. Global Finance also targets the 8,000 international portfolio investors responsible for more than 80% of all global assets under professional management. Its website –– www.gfmag.com –– offers analysis and articles that are the heritage of 22 years of experience in international financial markets, and provides a valuable source of data on 192 countries. Headquartered in New York, with offices in London, Rio de Janeiro and Milan.
